skill.name: perplexity-search
skill.description: Perform AI-powered web searches with real-time information using Perplexity models via LiteLLM and OpenRouter. This skill should be used when conducting web searches for current information, finding recent scientific literature, getting grounded answers with source citations, or accessing information beyond the model's knowledge cutoff. Provides access to multiple Perplexity models including Sonar Pro, Sonar Pro Search (advanced agentic search), and Sonar Reasoning Pro through a single OpenRouter API key.

content.user_title: Search Current Information with Perplexity AI
content.value_statement: Access real-time web information beyond AI training cutoffs. Get grounded answers with source citations using Perplexity models through OpenRouter.

Access multiple Perplexity models (Sonar Pro, Sonar Pro Search, Reasoning)
Save search results to JSON files

use_cases.title: Find Recent Scientific Literature
use_cases.description: Search for latest publications, clinical trials, and research developments beyond database indexing delays.

use_cases.title: Verify Current Facts
use_cases.description: Get up-to-date information with source citations for assignments and research papers.

use_cases.title: Track Industry Developments
use_cases.description: Monitor latest trends, technologies, and market changes in your field with real-time data.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Search
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the latest developments in CRISPR gene editing in 2024?

prompt_templates.title: Scientific Literature
prompt_templates.prompt: Find peer-reviewed studies published in 2024 about gut microbiome and Parkinson's disease, focusing on specific bacterial species identified.

prompt_templates.title: Comparative Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare PyTorch versus TensorFlow for transformer models based on recent benchmarks, ease of use, and ecosystem support.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Research
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct comprehensive analysis of competing CAR-T therapy approaches including mechanisms, clinical outcomes, and cost-effectiveness with 2024 data.

output_examples.input: What are the latest quantum computing breakthroughs in 2024?
output: Summary of implications and next steps

best_practices: Be specific with timeframes and domains for better results
Use model selection guide to optimize cost vs complexity
Include source preferences for scientific queries
Monitor usage and set spending limits in OpenRouter
anti_patterns: Avoid broad, vague queries without context
Do not use for simple calculations within model knowledge
Avoid excessive token usage without cost consideration
Never commit API keys to version control

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, works seamlessly with Claude Code and other scientific skills in the ecosystem.

faq.question: What are the usage limits?
faq.answer: Depends on your OpenRouter credits. Monitor usage at openrouter.ai/activity and set spending limits.

faq.question: How do I integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Use search results as input for literature-review, scientific-writing, or hypothesis-generation skills.

faq.question: Is my search data safe?
faq.answer: Searches go through OpenRouter to Perplexity. Follow OpenRouter's privacy policy and avoid sensitive data.

faq.question: Why am I getting rate limited?
faq.answer: OpenRouter has rate limits. Add delays between requests or upgrade your rate limit in the dashboard.

faq.question: How does this compare to regular web search?
faq.answer: Provides AI-synthesized answers with citations rather than just links, plus access to latest research.
